sessions.title: Accelerating Disruption in the Automotive Industry with Unity

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Traditional processes to design, manufacture, market, sell and maintain cars are being disrupted through the use of AR/VR/MR. Using Unity's multi-hardware deployment platform, software developers can now deliver the perfect tools for Automotive brands to optimize or rethink various processes that have remained unchanged for years. During this intermediate-level session, you will see examples of globally deployed configurators by a luxury-vehicle brand, CAD tracking of a real engine with AR developed for training and maintenance purposes, and how software modularity permits easy scalability and multiple use cases.

speaker.title: Co-founder, Business Catalyst
speaker.bio: David is co-founder and business catalyst for Visionaries 777. His first experience with interactive technologies came from co-designing and programming media facades with LED DMX-driven systems across Asia, the Middle East and Latin America. He resides in Hong Kong, where he leads strategic growth partnerships and key customer relations.

speaker.title: Co-founder, Project Lead
speaker.bio: Frantz is a co-founder and project leader for the automotive department in Visionaries 777. He has a master's degree in Interaction Design with a focus on Augmented Reality. His final degree project, based on AR, and was selected for presentation at SIGGRAPH 2009 (New Orleans) and SIGGRAPH Asia 2009 (Yokohama). After his studies, he joined LEGO's concept lab, in an R&D role that explored and prototyped several innovative concepts primarily based on AR that helped envision the future of play experience. He now leads teams working on interactive software tools deployed globally by brands such as BMW and Infiniti.

sessions.title: AI for Behavior: How Advanced Research Will Revolutionize the Way You Create

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: The Behavior Planner is a new AI-driven system created by Unity Labs that gives a game object the ability to reason on how it should act, based on predetermined choice criteria in an authoring flow that can be used for NPCs, game design feedback, player tutorials and more. Part feature breakdown and part AI master class, come to this session to hear Unity's Trevor Santarra and Nicolas Meuleau describe the research powering this capability and the state-of-the-art set of algorithms that power the underlying planning system.

speaker.title: Research Engineer, AI
speaker.bio: Trevor is a Research Engineer at Unity Labs, creating tools for automated behavior planning. Before Unity, he was a graduate student at the University of California – Santa Cruz, where he investigated information-theoretic strategies for coordinating multi-agent teams. Straddling the divide between industrial and academic research, Trevor strives to bring state-of-the-art approaches to game AI.

speaker.title: Director of AI Research
speaker.bio: Nicolas is a researcher in AI with expertise in decision-making, automated planning, and machine learning. During his 25-year career, he has developed and deployed autonomous decision systems for a variety of application domains, including space, aeronautics, automotive and finance. He recently joined Unity as Director of AI Research to promote the development of next-generation AI tools in Unity.

sessions.title: Autonomous Vehicle Development with Unity

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this intermediate-level session, Jose De Oliveira, who heads up Unity's Autonomous Vehicles Strategy, will reveal our roadmap to leverage the leading 3D real-time rendering engine for creating a simulation and visualization framework for automotive projects. In particular, he will focus on how Unity is ideal for supporting the development of autonomous vehicle technologies and processes.

speaker.title: Principal Engineer, Lead of Autonomous Vehicles Strategy
speaker.bio: Jose leads Unity's autonomous vehicles strategies, part of our Industrial initiatives. He joined Unity's Machine Learning team in May 2017, and works out of our office in Bellevue, WA. Prior to Unity, he spent 17 years at Microsoft on projects ranging from real-time communications to enterprise security systems. He started his Machine Learning career working on content-filtering solutions for Family Safety back in 2006. He headed the team that delivered the first anti-phishing features (SmartScreen) in IE 7. Later, he joined Bing Ads, where he led the development of paid search relevance models on mobile devices. In his last two years at Microsoft, he worked on Bing Maps, developing geospatial and map-creation technology, and continued that work during almost two years at Uber.

sessions.title: AutoTech: to be revealed
Best Practices for Scalable & Real-Time Multiplayer Games

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Creating great real-time multiplayer games, which are both performant and scalable, requires a lot of knowledge and experience. Take a shortcut! In this intermediate-level session, join the specialists from Multiplay, a Unity company, to learn key concepts and lessons for your next real-time multiplayer game.

speaker.title: Lead Solutions Engineer
speaker.bio: With over 17 years' experience as an engineer in hosting and gaming, Larry works with game engineers from  around the world to design and implement game-server hosting solutions that are focused on the genre-specific gamer experiences. Learn how he and his team have overcome some of the toughest challenges in scaling multiplayer games – from 4-player co-ops to 100-player battle royale games.

speaker.title: Head of Sales
speaker.bio: Matthew heads up the Sales, Client & Solutions teams at Multiplay, a Unity company. In this role, he leads engagements with game studios around the world to plan and design robust hosting infrastructure for their multiplayer games. Matthew has over 14 years' experience in hosting and gaming and has been instrumental in driving Multiplay's reputation as the go-to game-server hosting specialist.

sessions.title: Best Practices for Shader Graph

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: With Shader Graph in Unity 2018, creating powerful and beautiful shaders has never been easier. But with great power, comes great responsibility. This intermediate-level session will explore best practices for rendering performance and shader creation workflow. We'll cover what happens under the hood, share tips to avoid common pitfalls, and highlight what to look for as Shader Graph readies for prime-time release in the near future.

speaker.title: Developer Relations Engineer
speaker.bio: For many years, Charles helped unblock and accelerate Xbox game development across the industry. He now works with Unity's Enterprise Support team, helping developers achieve their Unity performance goals.

sessions.title: Better Unity Scripting with Rider

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Rider is a cross platform C# script editor that really understands Unity. Let's take a look at how it can make you a better, more productive Unity developer. We'll see how to get started (spoiler: it's really easy) and how Rider's deep understanding of your project will help you navigate your codebase quicker, edit your Unity scripts smarter, debug your project (even on devices) run tests, and find and fix issues before they cause problems at runtime. This session will give you all the best tips and tricks that will make Rider your favorite new script editor for Unity.

speaker.title: Technical Evangelist
speaker.bio: Matt Ellis is a developer advocate at JetBrains. He has spent 20 years shipping software and currently works with language tooling, having fun with plugins, abstract syntax trees and source code analysis. He owns and contributes to various open source projects, and believes in the open closed principle.(

sessions.title: Beyond ArchViz: Discovering the value in interactivity

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Learn how Mortenson, one of the world's largest construction companies, has developed their approach to facilitating design, training personnel, and engaging customers through immersive simulations. By comparing some of their earlier projects to their most recent work, you'll see how they have learned to use Unity to generate value for major brands, and begin to explore their vision for the future of the medium.

speaker.title: VR Developer
speaker.bio: Will was pursuing his masters of architecture at the University of Minnesota when he discovered virtual reality (VR) and its potential to impact design and construction. He began researching real-world applications of the medium with Mortenson Construction, which is headquartered in Minneapolis and has an ongoing partnership with the university. He's now an Emerging Technologies Developer at Mortenson, growing a division focused on applying emerging technology to Mortenson's customers' businesses. His passion for architecture, programming, and technologies like virtual reality led him to explore how the intersection of these fields can positively impact the rapidly changing building industry.

speaker.title: Immersive Technology Developer
speaker.bio: Marc is an Emerging Technologies Developer for Mortenson Construction and works out of their Seattle, WA office. In this role, he's responsible for the company's use of augmented and virtual reality and is looking to push the industry forward one project at a time through stunning visuals and compelling interactions. Kinsman was previously an integrated construction coordinator for the firm and was responsible for implementation and coordination of virtual design and construction processes throughout projects. He has a bachelor's degree in construction management from the University of Washington, where his studies included a heavy emphasis on BIM/VDC, design build and building performance analysis.

sessions.title: BMW TV-2 VR LAB: Cross-Discipline XR Experiences for Automotive

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value:
Since 2015, the BMW TV2i-VR Lab has been working on creating XR experiences to enhance internal processes across the automotive sector. Established as a digital experience R&D powerhouse, the multidisciplinary team is formed by students and experts from across the globe. 

Based in Munich, the Lab works across multiple departments inside BMW to explore the opportunities of XR technologies, new digital mediums (BIM, Pointcloud, CAD, AI), deliver proof of concept prototypes, and build applications and toolkits for BMW internal use.  

Working with Unity as a platform for interactive digital experiences has helped the Lab build use cases for BMW marketing, logistics training procedures, production layout and planning, machine learning training, and workflow simulations. As a full in-house team, the BMW VR Lab focuses on designing, prototyping and developing applications that go beyond automotive visualization, and bring to life applications that disrupt and enhance traditional working processes across the automotive space.

text.name: TALK_TEXT2
text.value:
-Auto Tech Industry
-VR for Business Interests
-Business
-Design + Development

text.name: TALK_TEXT3
text.value: Our talk will include case studies of XR experiences design for Automotive Industry, with a focus on internal company workflows. Audiences will get an understanding of the opportunities developing with Unity in-house offers for large scale companies, and how Unity and XR can be utilised as more then a method for marketing/visualisation in the automotive sector, but as a valuable tool for enhancing traditional work practises. The talk will highlight current projects from the BMW VR Lab and spotlight future project directions.

text.name: TALK_TEXT4
text.value: This talk would best fit the Unity Auto Tech Summit, as witnessed in Berlin 2018.

speaker.title: Design Team Lead (TV2i)
speaker.bio:
Based in Munich, Australian designer Dylan Sheppard leads the BMW TV-2i VRLab design team, supporting a wide range of projects across digital experience design. His work has been recognised by the Design Institute of Australia, receiving the DIA Professional Achievement Award in 2016, as well as being the recipient of both the DIA’s 2017 Industrial Design Graduate of the Year, and the 2017 Australian State Design Graduate Award. 

Dylan’s background in product design, working with start-ups, design consultancies and international brands, developed a broad skillset which he brings to his team at BMW. Dylan’s projects have continued to gain international recognition, including being shortlisted for the Braun International Design Prize, featured in international design publications, and through presenting as a guest speaker at the 2017 Global Youth Leadership Summit in Hong Kong.

speaker.title: VR Content Creator
speaker.bio:
Peter has studied as an Industrial Designer, and for the last year has been working in the VR Lab at BMW in Munich, leading development in use cases for BMW marketing, logistics training procedures, production layout and planning and workflow simulations. 

As the touchpoint for the progression of planned use cases into their development stage using Unity, Peter manages a workflow between the inter-departmental planning stages through to the rollout of final applications to BMW plants internationally. Peter continues to support VR projects across BMW by overseeing the planning and installation of  ‘satellite’ VR Labs at multiple BMW plants, supporting digitization and new technology rollout across the entire BMW production Network.

speaker.title: VR Content Creator and BIM Specialist
speaker.bio: Frieder studied civil engineering in Munich and his focus lies in developing and implementing Building Information Modeling (BIM) methods in Unity. At BMW, he works with Unity to bring collaborative digital factory design into VR.

sessions.title: C# Job System + ECS Usage and Demo with Intel

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: This intermediate-level session will showcase examples of the C# Job System + ECS (Entity Component System), and explain how to take advantage of this new Unity feature to optimize your CPU usage.

speaker.title: Graphics and Multicore Developer Relations Engineer
speaker.bio: Issam is a Graphics and Multicore Developer Relations Engineer at Intel. He has worked in the game industry for the last 14 years, contributing to games and engines for handheld, consoles and PC.

sessions.title: Capturing Real-World Materials for Real-Time Development

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this beginner-level session, two Unity 3D content-creation experts will demonstrate how to capture real-world materials, such as leather, fabrics, plastics, rubber and non-reflective metals – using low-cost, easily-accessible photography equipment and the photometric stereo technique – and then bring them into Unity for developing automotive applications.

speaker.title: Senior Solutions Developer, Automotive
speaker.bio: Luc is a Senior Solutions Developer at Unity, based in Montreal, Canada. Working in the movie and architecture industries for over 13 years, he has contributed to the fields of photorealistic rendering, FBX format, virtual movie sets, Unity Services and 3D content-creation tools.

speaker.title: Technical Artist
speaker.bio: Camille is a Technical Artist specialized in photometry and she is currently working on Unity's automotive material library. She joined Unity in Montreal in March 2018 as an intern and has since worked on two real-time Lexus teasers with the Automotive and Brand & Design teams. Fresh out of school, she studied 3D and video game development.

sessions.title: Cinematic Storytelling Techniques

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: From the Webby-Award winning team behind the "Adam" (2016) and "Book of the Dead" (2018) short films comes a retrospective on their latest project. Come see how the film harnesses Unity's capabilities to solve challenges in lighting, graphics, and other cinematic endeavors. You will also hear best practices on real-time filmmaking from producer, Silvia Rasheva, and learn how you can apply these storytelling techniques to your next project.

speaker.title: Producer, Demo Team
speaker.bio: .Silvia Rasheva leads Unity's Demo team, whose real-time rendered short films, "The Blacksmith" (2015) and "Adam" (2016) and the latest cinematic-interactive demo "Book of the Dead" (2018), put Unity at the forefront of the real-time filmmaking trend. Having transitioned to the game industry from a background in CG and VFX / post-production, Silvia is passionate about the innovation and creative empowerment that real-time technology can bring to the film industry.

sessions.title: CocoVR: Pixar Storytelling in an Interactive, Multiplayer World

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Pixar's virtual reality debut, "Coco VR," takes the adventure, beautiful artwork and narrative of the Disney-Pixar film, "Coco," into a whole new dimension. Complete with selfie machines, cable cars, live music, skull painting, art museums, and more, the audience enjoys a one-of-a-kind social experience together with friends and family.  A testament to the power of transmedia, this piece is both a feat of storytelling prowess and an ambitious technical accomplishment. Come hear Pixar and Magnopus dive into the details of how they approached the design challenges and listen to their predictions for immersive storytelling in the years to come.

speaker.title: Co-founder
speaker.bio: The Co-Founder and CEO of Magnopus, Ben Grossmann is an Emmy and Oscar-winning visual effects supervisor and VR Director whose resume includes films like JJ Abrams' "Star Trek Into Darkness," Martin Scorsese's "Hugo," Tim Burton's "Alice in Wonderland," and dozens more. With a decade-plus of experience in media and entertainment, Ben has also worked on next-gen projects like the Universal Studios' Forbidden Journey theme park ride for the Harry Potter franchise and, via Magnopus, on the Emmy-nominated VR experience "Mission: ISS," a game-engine powered recreation of the International Space Station, developed in collaboration with NASA, the European Space Agency, Oculus and others. Ben is a member of the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences, the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences, and the Visual Effects Society.

speaker.title: Supervising Technical Director
speaker.bio: John Halstead began his career at Pixar Animation Studios in June 2000.  Brought on for the Academy Award®-winning, "Finding Nemo," Halstead worked on sets-modeling and articulation and effects for the film.  Halstead continued as sets technical lead for the Golden Globe®-winning feature, "Cars," and as sets supervisor on another Oscar®-winner, "Up," and "Cars 2." He was most recently the supervising technical director on Disney•Pixar's feature film, "Finding Dory."

sessions.title: Create Amazing Visual Effects with the VFX Editor

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: The VFX Editor gives artists of all experience levels the power to create amazing visual effects. In this intermediate-level session, Alessia Nigretti from our Technical Evangelist team will give you a sneak peek into how to generate millions of GPU-based particles in real-time using the VFX Editor's toolset.

speaker.title: Technical Evangelist Intern
speaker.bio: Alessia is a technical evangelist at Unity and an AI enthusiast. She started developing small games at game jams and hackathons, and she joined Unity to develop and demonstrate feature projects and to share tips about Unity at conferences and meet-ups around the world. As a gamer, she is passionate about immersive story-based adventures and anything experimental.

sessions.title: Creating Adaptive Gaming Experiences

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this intermediate-level session, learn how to adapt your game for optimal and personalized user experiences, from onboarding throughout the entire gameplay. Device performance directly affects how enjoyable your game is. Unity LiveTune adjusts your content dynamically for every device to achieve optimal quality and performance so you can provide the best playing experiences across 50,000+ mobile device models and keep the players engaged.

speaker.title: Product Manager, Live Tune
speaker.bio: Elie Noune is the product manager for LiveTune, a data-driven performance optimization product being developed by Unity Analytics. At Unity, Elie's focus has been around using data to help developers understand and solve for device fragmentation, with products like Device Intelligence and now LiveTune. Elie graduated from the American University of Beirut and Stanford University with a BS and MS in Electrical Engineering.

speaker.title: Product Manager, Analytics
speaker.bio: At Unity, Lauren is the Head of the Adaptive Onboarding team in Developer Analytics. Prior to Unity, she worked as an analytics consultant, helping studios use data to increase retention and monetization of their players. She has over 10 years' experience in gaming, having worked with top entertainment companies, including American Girl Dolls, Warner Bros., and AMC (The Walking Dead). Lauren completed her undergraduate studies at Carnegie Mellon University and her masters at the University of Pennsylvania.

sessions.title: Creating Augmented & Mixed Reality Applications for the Auto Industry

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: It's an extremely exciting time in automotive, with major advances underway in assisted driving, ride-sharing, electrification and more. And cars themselves are evolving beyond just transportation, with the passenger's digital experience becoming of equal importance to the vehicle's exterior design or mechanical performance. In this session – which showcases projects from Nissan, Honda, Mattel, and the LA Auto Show – learn how Unity's flexibility allows users to create powerful augmented (AR) and mixed reality (MR) applications for a wide variety of use cases, including enterprise tools that let global design teams collaborate in real-time, hot marketing apps that transform consumers' in-dealership experience, and AR/MR/VR apps for imagining the future of transportation.

speaker.title: CEO and Executive Creative Director
speaker.bio:
Jason is the CEO and Executive Creative Director of Trigger – The Mixed Reality Agency™, with offices in Los Angeles and Aarhus, Denmark. He has creatively led over 100,000 hours of development in mixed reality (MR), including as a Snapchat Lens Studio Partner and as a showcase developer for Vuforia (a leading AR platform) and Google.

Jason's recent high-profile work incorporates mixed reality in marketing (Star Wars: The Last Jedi), product development (Hot Wheels – Augmoto), location-based experiences (Fish Designer for LEGO House) and enterprise tools (AR Design Evaluation tool for Honda), all of which demonstrate the wide spectrum of use cases for mixed reality across all industries.

In 2015, Jason returned to his childhood home to speak at TEDx Hong Kong on "Computer Vision Bringing Toys to Life." Additionally, he has four assigned patents in AR/MR, with several more pending. He was also featured in Apple's first TV show: Planet of the Apps and won two LA Auto Show Design Challenges back-to-back with his partners at LEGO and the Honda Advanced Design.

speaker.title: Senior Director of Technology
speaker.bio: Danny is the Senior Director of Technology at Trigger – The Mixed Reality Agency™, where he leads projects for some of Trigger's biggest clients, including Mattel/Hot Wheels, Honda, the Star Wars franchise, LEGO and more. Danny is an integral part of the Trigger team as he is actively involved with all technological decisions, from ideation through to product delivery, and oversees all projects that the development team works on. His first project at Trigger was McDonald's GOL! for the 2014 FIFA World Cup; available in 119 countries, this was the most advanced AR mobile app at the time of its launch. Danny started his career at Google as a Developer Operations and at UCLA as Programmer-Analyst. With 12 years of tech and software engineering experience, he applies great knowledge of Unity and other aspects of software development to every project.

sessions.title: Democratize Machine Learning: ML-Agents Explained

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Recent advances in mathematics, computation, and data are radically redefining what is possible with machine learning (ML). These new techniques have made ML not only more tractable, but broadened the potential uses for it in game production and beyond!  In this session, we'll go over Unity ML-Agents, an open source toolkit that bridges the world of Unity and Machine Learning.  We'll go over how advances in AI, such as reinforcement and imitation learning, can open the door for new ways of game development.

speaker.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
speaker.bio: Arthur Juliani is a Machine Learning Engineer at Unity Technologies, and the lead developer of Unity ML-Agents. A researcher at the intersection of Cognitive Neuroscience and Deep Learning, Arthur is currently working toward a Ph.D. at the University of Oregon. An active blogger on topics such as Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, and Cognitive Science, his Medium blog has reached over 100,000 readers.  Arthur is also a contributor to well-known machine learning publications such as O'Reilly, and Hanbit Media.

sessions.title: Developing Immersive Experiences with ARCore

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this intermediate-level session, you will learn about Google's recently launched AR platform, ARCore: How it works, the vast breadth of applications it enables, and how you can get started developing on ARCore.

speaker.title: Product Manager
speaker.bio: Rahul is a product manager on the Google Daydream team, working on the ARCore platform. Prior to ARCore, Rahul helped build the Daydream VR software and hardware platform. In a previous life, he was a software engineer specializing in operating systems. He holds a BA in computer science and mathematics from Ohio Wesleyan University and an MS in computer science from UNC-Chapel Hill.

sessions.title: Developing Realistic Sensors for AV Simulations

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: This session will focus on sensor creation and explore the challenges around building simulated sensors that can be used for the development of autonomous vehicles, including the most common types and techniques and hear from partners that have been developing highly accurate sensor models on Unity.

sessions.title: Digital Omotenashi: Bringing the Lexus UX to Life via the Magic of Real-Time

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this high-level session, discover how the convergence of marketing and technology is changing the world of automotive marketing and customer experience through the lens of the Lexus UX's journey to market. As trends such as the proliferation of touch, omni-channel personalization, cloud services, new devices and media demand, and machine learning/AI take hold and evolve, explore how new solutions from Unity can benefit wide-ranging applications, including working with design data, dynamic use cases, design and engineering visualization, and marketing and advertising.

speaker.title: Management Director, Digital
speaker.bio:
Digital practitioner, basset hound rescuer, husband, amateur wine snob, Seattle-native, and USC Trojan.

By day, Joe is head of digital at Team One (Saatchi & Saatchi/Publicis Groupe's premium, luxury, and aspirational brand agency), where he leads a multi-disciplinary team of strategists, creatives, and technologists, and works with clients like Lexus, the Ritz-Carlton, and Indian Motorcycle. By night, Joe is head of TiltShift, Publicis Groupe's VR/immersive reality consultancy and production studio.
 
Before joining Team One, Joe opened and led the Razorfish Los Angeles office, where he managed the Honda and Acura digital agency of record account. He led the T-Mobile digital account during its industry-revolutionizing "Un-carrier" brand relaunch, and worked with companies like Visa, Amazon, and Qualcomm.
 
Joe is recognized for implementing transformative ideas in complex organizations, including a global enterprise technology strategy he led for Procter & Gamble, which Apple featured in a case study in their marketing.
 
In addition to helping some of the world's leading brands develop and implement their digital strategies, Joe has a passion for the arts. He founded the world's largest non-profit educational jazz festival in honor of his father, Frank. And during his time at Seattle-based digital agency POP, his team developed and managed the websites, mobile apps, e-commerce, and email programs for organizations like Carnegie Hall, the Sydney Opera House, the Royal Opera House, and the Metropolitan Opera. Joe also led the development of one of the first mobile ticketing platforms, a highly-scalable ticket engine, and in partnership with his long-time hero Frank Gehry, he led the design of digital installations for New York City's new Signature Theatre.

Don't tell anyone, but before working for agencies, Joe sang backup vocals for artists like the Steve Miller Band, Bonnie Raitt, and Kurt Elling.

sessions.title: Directing a VR Experience with Baobab

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: To be revealed

sessions.title: ECS: Building a Living, Breathing World on a Shoestring Budget

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: An introduction to he the editing tools developed for streaming worlds and how we utilized nested prefabs and variants to manage permutations and ease content productions. In addition, we will cover the optimizations made to render the scene.

speaker.title: Technical Art Director
speaker.bio: Martin has been making art for games for two decades, his first steps into game art were made modding the first Quake engine games and today his experience in game production spans 4 console generations. Originally starting in environment art he expanded into technical art and tool design, he previously lead the environment art team at Io Interactive (SQEX) on the Hitman series where he also collaborated on tools and rendering development. Since 2016 he has worked as Technical Art Director on Sample Games at Unity Technologies.

sessions.title: ECS: Changing Transforms? On it!

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: The Transform component is a core part of Unity, used by almost all other systems. This session will explain how and why it has changed for ECS.

speaker.title: Programmer
speaker.bio:
Jens started by writing BASIC programs with pen and paper. Eventually, his parents realized that this wasn't a passing fad and bought him his first computer. He's called himself a programmer ever since.

Jens started in the games industry in 2000 with IO Interactive and has worked on games ranging from indie-size to AAAA blockbusters. He has mainly worked with engine tech and tools and believes strongly in engine development being driven by the needs of the games using it.

Jens started at Unity Technologies in 2016, where he has mainly worked on changes to the Transform component and the systems that use it.

sessions.title: ECS: Deep Dive into the Burst Compiler

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this talk, you will learn more about the behind the scene of the burst compiler: The challenges of generating better native code from a subset of IL/.NET called High Performance C#. How burst is being developed and tested. What kind of optimizations burst can bring and how to take advantage of it in your project by using a data-oriented programming approach. What we are looking into to improve in the future.

speaker.title: Software Engineer
speaker.bio:
Alexandre joined Unity Technologies in 2016 as a Software Engineer to lead the development of a new compiler technology from C# to native code. Prior to this, he was involved for 5 years in the architecture and development of an innovative game engine entirely written in C#. He is also an Open-Source developer that has been contributing to several OSS projects including SharpDX, Markdig... He has been awarded as a Microsoft MVP since 2014 in Visual Studio and Development Technologies.

Alexandre is passionate about working on a wide range of different problems, from low-level to high-level, in the domain of real-time graphics rendering, GPGPU, audio synthesis, efficient usage of managed languages, documentation and code generation, language design, building workflows. He loves to work on complex systems, improve their designs, empower the users and bring a strong technical leadership.

sessions.title: ECS: Graph Driven Audio in an ECS World

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: A new C# job-based audio rendering engine has been developed for Unity. This session will cover an introduction to this low-level audio renderer along with the ECS technology to bring large-scale audio to the demo.

speaker.title: TBC
speaker.bio:
Wayne has been working for Unity since 2012 and has enjoyed working on a wide range of exciting and innovative features throughout his tenureship.

Throughout his career he's developed a strong interest in observing users workflow and feature needs and abstracting and developing them into a cohesive, forward thinking technology and tooling offering. In this capacity he is currently serving as the tech lead on a number of core tech and feature projects within Unity.

In his spare time he enjoys cave diving and bringing technology to the world of this hobby, particularly in developing unique vision based mapping and 3D reconstruction solutions.

sessions.title: ECS: LOD and Culling Systems that Scale

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: How we used Capsicum to display a large environment in the Unite LA streaming demo.

speaker.title: Principal Engineer
speaker.bio:
Mike Acton has worked on game engines for over 20 years including as the Engine Director of Insomniac Games for more than 10 years. He has learned hard lessons about what it takes to produce some of the highest quality work in the space and what is needed to meet those requirements. Mike is at Unity to make that possible for more people by helping to democratize data-oriented programming so that teams everywhere can achieve things only previously possible by a few dedicated groups. Mike edits in vi and prefers spaces to tabs.
 
Mike believes strongly in the importance of giving back to our community. None of us could have done our jobs well without relying on the work of others and those giants that came before us, and we have a duty to return that favor.

sessions.title: ECS: Spline-based AI Agents

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this session we will take a look at the traffic simulation in the demo. We examine the compute kernels and the code Burst produces for them. We will also cover the spline-based AI agents and how they were developed with the ECS.

speaker.title: Software Engineer
speaker.bio:
Lee has worked as a programmer, at various levels and companies within the games industry for nearly 20 years. He started out making Gameboy Colour games, and finished off making games for PS4/Xbox One/PC before joining Unity Technologies in December 2017. He now spends his time working on the Burst compiler, and helping out wherever he can.

Lee is probably best known to the wider world by his various pseudonyms, none of which he will reveal here. His free time is spent resurrecting/reverse engineering old hardware, pulling at threads, and generally have a nice time playing board games.

speaker.title: Principal Engineer
speaker.bio:
Andreas has worked on blockbuster games at DICE and Insomniac Games. He's credited on titles like Battlefield 2 and 3, as well as Ratchet and Clank PS4 and Sunset Overdrive. His career has mostly been focused on engine development, optimization and team leadership. At DICE, he was a part of the Frostbite engine team, working on the technology that powers EA's internal engine. At Insomniac, Andreas served as a lead engine programmer and gameplay director.

At Unity, Andreas works on the future direction on the Unity engine which aims to democratize Data-Oriented Design.

sessions.title: ECS: Streaming and Serialization

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this in-depth talk we'll cover entity serialization to and from disk, how we built seamless play mode streaming and efficient editor workflow, and what a separate ECS world can do for you.

speaker.title: Software Engineer
speaker.bio:
Simon has been working in the games industry since the original PlayStation time where 1 MB of memory was a lot. Through the years he maintained his keen interest in understanding the underlying hardware and how to optimize for it. This was instrumental in the development of the Glacier 2 engine that powered Hitman and Deus Ex games. 

Simon joined Unity in 2015 to help modularize and modernize the engine. For the last year he has helped develop the ECS system.

speaker.title: Developer
speaker.bio:
Fabrice has been a programmer in the games industry since 2003, working for small studios on a wide range of games for PC, mobile and consoles. Besides writing code, he enjoys explaining it, and has also been a teacher for a few years. He joined Unity in early 2018, and hasn't been fired yet.

He has a passion for the history of computing, most particularly everything that predates the microcomputer revolution. When not in front of a keyboard or card punch, he can be found reading a book or hiking.

sessions.title: ECS: Using the Entity Debugger

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: This is an introductory session on the functions of the Entity Debugger, and some discussion of its place in future versions of Unity

speaker.title: Editor Developer
speaker.bio:
Daniel is a long-time Unity user and tools programmer with a passion for user interface design. He enjoys reducing the number of steps and amount of time it takes users to get their work done.

He got his start in the games industry making hidden object games in Canada, eventually supporting a small team making more and more complex games. He moved to Copenhagen in 2015 to join the Editor team at Unity to work on tools used by several orders of magnitude more people.

sessions.title: ECS: Welcome and General Overview

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Joachim Ante will open the ECS track by presenting what he and his team have been working on for the last 6 months.

speaker.title: CTO
speaker.bio: Joachim Ante currently serves as the Chief Technology Officer of Unity Technologies and helped co-found the company in 2002. Joachim initially began writing the core of Unity as a teenager, and today the engine is in the hands of more than 4.5 million registered developers. As Unity's chief technology officer and co-founder, Joachim has brought pro-level game tools to the masses and is playing a significant role in the renaissance of independent games.

sessions.title: Fast Worldbuilding with Unity's Updated Terrain System & ProBuilder

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: This beginner session will show you how to quickly create and iterate on playable levels using ProBuilder and the recently updated Terrain system.

speaker.title: Unity Evangelist
speaker.bio: Dan is an AR/VR evangelist at Unity. He has worked in game development for several years as a developer, with a recent focus in VR. He's excited to help others explore the forefront of new and emergent technologies, and the many unique opportunities they present.

speaker.title: Evangelist
speaker.bio: Regularly engaging with the game development community, Liz has the fortunate opportunity to encourage and empower the next generation of game development talent. Whether she is mentoring at student game jams, delivering talks on the latest Unity features or getting involved in local initiatives to promote computer games as a viable career option, she realizes the importance of empowering developers, instilling confidence and promoting diversity in the game development community.

sessions.title: Film: to be revealed
From 0 to 90: Achieving Peak Performance in Multiplatform VR Development

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value:
Great VR can transform our perception of reality, but in order to achieve this, it's critical that you develop an experience that runs at an optimized framerate for your target platform.

In this intermediate-level session, Devin Reimer (Chief Executive Owl) and Andrew Eiche (Chief Technology Owl), will share the best practices and optimization techniques used to develop Owlchemy Labs' award-winning multi-platform games.

You'll learn techniques for optimizing Unity projects to meet the often extreme performance requirements of VR, including detailed use of profiling, understanding batching, writing performant scripts, object hierarchies, managing and debugging the Unity physics system, offloading processing to Unity Jobs, and writing efficient shaders.

speaker.title: CEO
speaker.bio: Devin Reimer is CEO (Chief Executive Owl) of game studio, Owlchemy Labs, creators of the multi-platform VR title 'Job Simulator,' 'Rick and Morty: Virtual Rick-ality,' and the upcoming 'Vacation Simulator.' With many years of Unity and game-development experience, Devin has led the creation of multiple VR launch titles on the HTC Vive, Oculus Touch, and PlayStation VR, maintaining Owlchemy's reputation for bringing award-winning content to new platforms.

speaker.title: CTO
speaker.bio: Andrew Eiche is CTO (Chief Technology Owl) and Cable Wrangler of game studio, Owlchemy Labs, creators of the multi-platform VR titles 'Job Simulator,' 'Rick and Morty: Virtual Rick-ality,' and the upcoming 'Vacation Simulator.' Throughout his career, he has developed games for indies, board-game companies, commercial industry and government agencies. He used to wear a suit and tie to work. He also made an app for the IRS. Things are better now.

sessions.title: From Design to Dealer - VR/AR Software Solutions for Getting to "Yes"

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: REWIND and its new global technology partners will be revealing their live meet and review platform in development, which promises to revolutionize the automotive industry's design process with rapid stakeholder and consumer feedback. The software will make the creation of a car faster, from early design steps to final focus group testing. The VR/AR platform will also allow for easy collaborative input from internal stakeholders to consumers to ensure the grand vision can actually be experienced through immersive technology before anything is built. Join REWIND and executive guests - leading hardware and OEM partners -  for a live demo and special announcement.

sessions.title: From Interactive to Automatic CAD Data Prep

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: PiXYZ CAD data-prep experts will show you how to use PiXYZ products to convert, optimize and conform 3D models coming from the CAD industrial world to Unity, taking into consideration the challenges and effort behind each part of the CAD asset transformation pipeline for XR applications. Along the way, they will cover everything from simple use cases to extensive automatic CAD data-prep usage.

speaker.title: Head of UX & Brand Development
speaker.bio: Geoffrey is Head of UX & Brand Development at PiXYZ Software, whose products help industrial companies and agencies reuse CAD data for any visualization scenario, saving time, effort and maximizing performance. Geoffrey has expertise in CAD/VR/AR experiences that are at the crossroads of R&D, UX, marketing and sales. Prior to PiXYZ Software, he spent 10 years at Dassault Systèmes, leading various VR/AR, R&D, marketing, and product strategy activities.

speaker.title: Product Manager & Professional Services Manager
speaker.bio: Axel is a Product Manager and Professional Services Manager at PiXYZ Software. The company provides a portfolio of products dedicated to CAD data preparation and optimization, and CAD review. He has eight years of experience in project management and has a strong background in 3D market/software.

sessions.title: Get off to a Great Start with Handheld AR

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Are you an aspiring handheld AR app developer but not quite sure where to begin? In this beginner session, Unity XR evangelist, Dan Miller, will show you how to use our new handheld AR template and multiplatform AR SDK to build an app across ARCore and ARKit devices. You'll also get best practices and tips that will boost your confidence so you can start creating handheld AR apps on your own.

speaker.bio: Dan is an XR evangelist at Unity, where he works closely with new and emergent technologies. As an evangelist, he develops and delivers content to a wide audience mainly in the Americas region. Before joining Unity, he worked on multiple VR games and applications, including Cyberpong, which has been featured in arcades around the world. Dan is excited to continue helping the community create unique, compelling experiences in the Virtual and Augmented Reality space.

sessions.title: Getting Started with the Lightweight Render Pipeline

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Andy will present a high-level overview of the technology behind the new Scriptable Render Pipeline (SRP) and demonstrate how to set up the Lightweight Scriptable Render Pipeline (LWRP) in the Editor. You will learn about the performance advantages that SRP can bring to projects targeting mobile platforms, VR and games with limited real-time lighting needs. You will also find out how the rendering features differ from the built-in renderer in a way that improves performance in limited platforms. Finally, you will learn how to get started using SRP for your project.

speaker.title: Unity Evangelist
speaker.bio: Andy Touch is a content evangelist at Unity. He focuses on creating example projects to demonstrate upcoming features and teaching the Unity community how they can take their games to the next level.

speaker.title: Graphics Product Manager
speaker.bio: Arisa Scott is Unity’s graphics product manager. She has a bachelors is in fine arts from Digipen, where she found a passion for game art pipelines. Before Unity, Arisa worked at several technology and game companies. Right before Unity Arisa was at Artifact Technologies, working on location based apps/games, and getting to hang out at comic cons to pitch games. Prior to that Arisa co-founded a game company, as the art director on a 2D CCG/tower defense game.

sessions.title: Graphics, Lighting and FX for Real-Time Animation

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this advanced session, John Parsaie, a Unity graphics expert, will walk attendees through best practices in shading and real-time lighting for episodic animation.

speaker.title: Graphics Software Engineer
speaker.bio: John is a Graphics Engineer at Unity, focused on production-oriented efforts with the Made with Unity team. He works closely with creators and studios to advance the graphical fidelity of showcased Unity productions such as ADAM: 2 & 3 and "Baymax Dreams." After developing new rendering features for specific projects, John shepherds them back to the Unity engine for all users to benefit. When not pushing pixels, John enjoys exploring all things tangible and analog in an effort to find balance with his digital passion.

sessions.title: Graphics: to be revealed
How to Build Organic 2D Worlds with Sprite Shape

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Sprite Shape brings organic 2D world-building to Unity. In this session, we will start by giving you an overview of the assets and components of Sprite Shape. Next, you'll see how we apply this feature to a shape-based level layout. Finally, together we will explore how we can access the underlying spline data to create engaging and visually appealing real-time results.

speaker.title: Technical Product Manager, 2D
speaker.bio: Rustum (Rus) is a Product Manager for 2D in R&D at Unity. He has been making games for more than 10 years and developing in Unity almost as long. Rus owns Craft Colony, a game production and consulting company, is a games technology generalist, and takes a holistic approach to game development. He is an MSC Malaysia Intellectual Property Creators Challenge (IPCC) winner. In 2012, Rus released Penyu the Turtle, a top‐down shooter for iOS. He also launched and managed Malaysia's first online portal for game assets. Previously, he was Technical Art Director at Big Bad Robots and Senior 3D Artist at GameBrains.

sessions.title: Inside the Magic at Magic Leap

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: What is spatial computing and is it the future of augmented reality? Find out more by attending this in-depth session led by Brian Schwab of Magic Leap. You'll hear about the design paradigm shift and a new set of tools you can use to explore and design exciting experiences around characters and environments.

speaker.title: Director of Interaction Lab
speaker.bio: After spending more than 20 years as a gameplay and AI programmer in the game industry, Brian Schwab joined a little Florida company who's mission was not so little: to fundamentally change how humans use and interact with their computers. So, while in his past he shipped everything from a simple Sega Genesis jrpg to the international blockbuster Hearthstone at Blizzard, he now runs the Interaction Lab, a systems research group within Magic Leap. In addition to using crazy new hardware to explore interactions from low level to hugely complex, his team also helps bring compelling experience to the forefront of the Magic Leap engineering efforts. Throughout this, his mission has never changed: to find fun, interactive experiences and share them with the world.

sessions.title: Introducing the New UI System That Will Replace IMGUI

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: We have designed a new UI system (targeted for 2019.1 release) that will replace IMGUI for extending the Editor. Learn how the new system – built for performance and scalability –  will have a comprehensible and conventional API and enable designers to easily contribute to styling and layout.

speaker.title: Sr. Technical Product Manager
speaker.bio: A seasoned software development manager with more than 18 years' experience in mobile and web development, Benoit is deeply motivated by the convergence of art and technology. At Unity, which he joined in January 2018 as a technical product manager, he has drawn on his background in the mobile gaming industry to provide insight on how to improve user experience.

sessions.title: Intuitive 3D Content Creation for Automotive VR

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: See how creating high-quality NURBS surfaces can be as natural and intuitive as sculpting in the real world. Built with Unity, Gravity Sketch is a multi-platform 3D-creation tool that enables you to immerse yourself in your design, eliminating barriers between your inspiration and 3D modeling. At this session, learn about the benefits of directly creating models in VR and meet the innovators who are bringing this new technology to the market.

speaker.title: Senior Automotive Designer, 3D Modeling and Visualization
speaker.bio:
James Robbins is a senior designer with the Digital Modeling and Visualization group at Honda R&D, Inc. He primarily works with Alias and Modo, but has now jumped head first into VR sketching, sculpting and modeling. James has always been interested in new design techniques and processes that can help the creative workflow.

James is a graduate of the Industrial Design: Transportation track from the University of Cincinnati. He's worked with many talented and inspiring design, marketing and engineering teams across many design fields to develop and implement products from concept through production.

sessions.title: Leverage MixPlay Interactivity to Grow Your Audience on Mixer

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: On Mixer, viewers play along with streamers via interactive elements created with the MixPlay development tool. This introduces a new paradigm for online multiplayer experiences. In this intermediate session, you'll learn how to quickly integrate MixPlay elements with your Unity game to create compelling content that streamers and viewers love. You'll leave with an understanding of how to successfully integrate MixPlay, and get a free promotion on Mixer.

speaker.title: Program Manager
speaker.bio: A computer engineer by trade, Mike Blouin is currently a program manager at Xbox, where he works on online competitive experiences.

sessions.title: Look Ma, No Jutter! Optimizing Performance Across Oculus Mobile

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: The introduction of mobile AR means the arrival of more accessible devices, and for developers, a broader range of consumers to target. The good news is that you're "already ready." A stable of universal techniques and best practices can help reduce draw calls and maximize performance without sacrificing fidelity across Gear VR, Oculus Go, and Project Santa Cruz. We'll start with an overview of the devices and basic considerations, and go step by step through the process of reviewing and optimizing textures, scene geometry, and lighting. Attendees interested in Project Santa Cruz will also benefit from an introduction to Unity's profiling workflow.

speaker.title: Developer Relations Engineer
speaker.bio: At Oculus, Gabor Szauer supports developers targeting mobile platforms like Gear VR, Oculus Go and the prototype Project Santa Cruz. In his spare time, he makes video games and has written a few books about game development.

sessions.title: Mobile AR and the Future of Authoring - Unity Labs

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: At this intermediate-level session, you'll meet the Unity Labs Authoring Tools Group, whose motto is "Reality is our build target," and whose goal is to enable developers to create apps that live in and react to the real world. They'll explain their approach to mixed reality (MR) development, talk about how the Project MARS Unity extension handles various data and simulations in the Editor, and also how they integrate with technology providers. Finally, you'll learn how the team is defining and handling privacy and permissions for spatial computing.

speaker.title: Advanced UX on the Labs Team at Unity
speaker.bio: Charles leads Advanced UX on the Unity Labs team. He has designed both 2D and 3D authoring systems over the past two decades, working for companies like Softimage, Microsoft, Avid, Sony, and Apple, before joining Unity in 2017. Working with teams of designers and engineers, his goal is to enable digital artists to achieve their creative vision with tools that are powerful, efficient, elegant and delightful to use.

speaker.title: Director of XR Research at Unity
speaker.bio: Timoni leads design on Unity's Labs team, focusing on the future of game development and creation tools in VR. Labs' first project, EditorVR, was released in December 2016. Before Unity, Timoni was SVP of Design at Alphaworks, and co-founder and creative director of Department of Design. She's also a mentor at the Upload Collective, advising new VR startups in the Bay Area.

speaker.title: Senior Software Engineer
speaker.bio: Andrew Maneri has dedicated his life to programming, designing, and creating. He has worked and produced in nearly every gaming and XR vertical. His passions are VR/AR, game development, graphics programming, technical art, automation, and animation. Andrew works with Unity Labs, a team of cross-disciplinary artists and engineers exploring new interfaces for human-computer interaction. His unique background and skill set have led to unorthodox and mind-bending experiments in the digital space.

speaker.title: Software Engineer
speaker.bio: Kyle is a software engineer at Unity Labs working on authoring tools and prototypes, including MARS and EditorXR. At USC, he studied computer science for video games and interned at the Jet Propulsion Lab on AR applications. Kyle's goal is to make new technology more accessible for all creators and to explore the frontiers of spatial computing and interactive entertainment.

sessions.title: Mobile Business: to be revealed
NASA AR Procedure Assistance for Space Applications

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: NASA JPL has an ongoing effort to utilize AR for enhancing procedure execution for space applications. In this session, Benjamin will present their latest AR procedure execution system running inside ProtoSpace, their immersive CAD visualization tool built with Unity and HoloLens. He'll also showcase real-world examples as well as discuss lessons learned and future applications.

speaker.title: Immersive User Interface Developer
speaker.bio: Benjamin is a mixed-reality researcher and developer focused on applying MR technologies to enhance mission planning and execution systems in the OpsLab at the NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). He currently works on ProtoSpace, a collaborative, immersive CAD visualization tool used in a variety of NASA projects. Before working at JPL, Benjamin researched MR remote collaboration in the Four Eyes Lab at the University of California, Santa Barbara, where he received his Ph.D. in Computer Science.

sessions.title: New Addressable Asset System for Speed and Performance

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: The new Addressable Asset system makes it much easier to manage your game assets and project workflow, and it gives you better options to optimize performance. In this advanced session, learn how the new system works and explore some common and challenging use cases.

speaker.title: Lead Software Developer
speaker.bio: Stephen is the Development Lead at Unity Austin, where he oversees the evolution of the Unity build pipeline, including Addressables, Asset Bundles and the Unity Cloud Build service. Prior to joining Unity, Stephen spent over 15 years as a professional game developer in a variety of roles, including level design, programming, and production. He has been on the ground floor of small indie studios, and also led large game projects with multi-million-dollar budgets and teams of 100+ individuals, managing communications with publishing partners, outsourcing studios, and sub-contracted developers. His credits include games in the Half-Life, Halo, Brothers in Arms, Borderlands, and Call of Duty series.

speaker.title: Senior Software Engineer
speaker.bio: Bill is a member of Unity Austin's Build Pipeline and Asset Bundle team. He is the technical lead on the new Addressable Assets project and is focused on improving asset management workflows. Prior to joining Unity, Bill was a software developer for over 10 years. Half that time he spent as a game and tools programmer in the brick-and-mortar casino games industry. He is credited with over a dozen casino games as well as several artist- and programmer-centric tools.

sessions.title: New Tools for Graphic Realism in Automotive

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this intermediate-level session, Adam Myhill, Unity's Head of Cinematics, will show you how you can achieve high-end graphics in Unity for automotive applications. You'll learn how Unity's High-Definition Render Pipeline (HDRP), Scriptable Render Pipeline (SRP), Cinemachine, Timeline, and the Post-Processing Stack can be used to produce stunning visuals with maximum fidelity for real-world materials. This session will also include a comprehensive breakdown of layout, rendering and 4K resolution, and how together they can help you level-up your project for trailers or cinematic applications.

speaker.title: Head of Cinematics
speaker.bio: Adam has spent almost two decades in the video game and film worlds, working as a Director of Photography and CG supervisor at EA, Pandemic and Blackbird Interactive across multiple titles, and as a feature-film DP on several movies. His procedural cinematic and in-game camera system, Cinemachine, was acquired by Unity, where he brings his cinematic, lighting and in-game camera experience as Head of Cinematics. He holds a number of patents in the area of CG camera technology, virtual cinematography and procedural camera behavior, in addition to his wicked, out-of-control obsession with lenses, especially vintage ones.

sessions.title: Octane 2018 for Unity: Cinematic and Holographic Media on the RNDR Blockchain

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Join Jules Urbach, co-founder and CEO of OTOY, as he previews the latest release of OctaneRender, Octane 2018, and upcoming features in Unity. In this advanced session, learn more about the latest in holographic rendering and its application on OTOY's RNDR network. Jules will dive into the goals and challenges of deploying a fully decentralized GPU ray tracing and streaming platform on top of the Ethereum blockchain, as well as how future phases of RNDR will unlock modular IP rights management of holographic media and AR services.

speaker.title: Founder, CEO and Chairman
speaker.bio: Jules is the visionary and strategic mind behind OTOY's pioneering work in computer graphics, streaming, and 3D rendering. With over 25 years of industry experience, he has been revolutionizing 3D content capture, creation, and delivery through his work with OTOY and LightStage. With his latest project (RNDR), Jules is working to utilize the blockchain to push content creation and rendering further than ever before.

sessions.title: Open Match: Multiplayer Matchmaking with Unity and Google

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Matchmaking is an essential component of today's most popular multiplayer games. Unity and Google are co-leading a new open-source project designed to tackle this common and challenging aspect of multiplayer game creation. Learn how it works and how you can get involved.

speaker.title: Product Manager
speaker.bio: As the product manager leading the strategy for Gaming on the Google Cloud Platform, Micah is committed to enabling developers to realize their vision for great games. An avid gamer on all major platforms, he never hesitates to get involved in games that were built with a passion for immersive storytelling, innovative multiplayer experiences and breathtaking artwork.

speaker.title: Product Manager
speaker.bio: For many years, it's been Brandi's passion to make games that connect people in exciting and creative ways. From Bungie to Funomena, she has explored game development ranging from AAA to indie. Now Oculus to Unity, she's focused on the technology required to democratize Connected Games, so more developers can bring the online games they dream of to life.

speaker.title: Senior Software Engineer
speaker.bio: Prior to Unity, Caleb worked at Microsoft on Xbox Live, designing and developing multiplayer services, publishing systems, and on the Minecraft store. Before that, he co-founded a computer-vision startup that built virtual fitting-room technology. Outside of work, Caleb's personal projects span a range of topics, including computer vision algorithms, game design, electronics and music.

sessions.title: Optimizing AR: How to Extend Battery Life and Avoid Overheating

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Two of the biggest hurdles for handheld AR development are device overheating and drained batteries. Attend this session to learn how simple development techniques and the right editor settings can maximize battery life and maintain controlled thermal conditions for your Unity AR project. This session is appropriate for all developer levels.

speaker.title: Developer Relations Manager
speaker.bio: Adam works with Unity's Enterprise Support team as the Lead Developer-Relations Manager on Unity's Enterprise Support team,  This role has offered him the opportunity to lead support efforts for some of the most notable Made With Unity games. Prior to his time at Unity, Adam spent nearly a decade in MMORPG production and development. Adam is as much a fan of Unity as he is a part of Unity, and continues to independently develop his own Made-with-Unity games.

sessions.title: Optimizing Engagement and LTV with Personalization

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Maximizing player lifetime value (LTV) requires a fine balance between in-app purchases, ads and more. In this session, two Unity product and monetization experts will explain how Unity uses machine learning to deliver each player a unique experience that optimizes for LTV.

speaker.title: Product Director
speaker.bio: Stephen is a Director of Product Management for Unity. In this role, he oversees new product development, business strategy, and go-to-market execution for Unity's Ads and Monetization products. He was previously the Director of Product Management at Chartboost, an Executive Producer and Senior Product Manager at Zynga and Founder of the mobile gaming startup, Playnomi. Stephen holds an MBA from MIT and a BS in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering from Seattle University.

speaker.title: Product Director
speaker.bio: As a Product Director at Unity, Felix oversees the development and deployment of revenue-optimization capabilities as well as programmatic advertising. Prior to Unity, Felix served as Senior Director, Yield and Monetization at AppNexus, where he was responsible for leading the monetization team to deploy initiatives that drove overall publisher revenue growth. He previously worked as Director of Ad Revenue and Strategy at Zynga, where he was responsible for driving new initiatives to optimize overall ad yield on supply for Zynga properties across mobile, video, and desktop. Felix also has a yield management background from both the management consulting and commercial aviation industry prior to his entry into tech. Felix holds an MSE in Operations Research Engineering and BSE in Computer Science Engineering, both from the University of Michigan.

sessions.title: Pixonic's Recipe for Success – Pairing Ads & IAP in War Robots

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Vladimir Krasilnikov, Pixonic's Head of Game Design, explains how they used Unity to build War Robots, and shares their strategy of implementing video ads — without hurting IAP revenue.

speaker.title: Head of Game Design
speaker.bio: Vladimir has worked as Head of Game Design at Pixonic since 2017. For over seven years prior to that, he was involved in developing free-to-play games for social networks and mobile devices, including War Robots. He has recently begun reviewing projects for publishing with Pixonic.

sessions.title: Prefab Workflow Improvements – An Introduction

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: In this session, Nikoline, a Unity UX Designer, will explain how recent improvements to the Prefab workflows will give you more control and make you more productive while you're building your projects. For example, she'll cover editing prefabs in Prefab mode, nesting Prefabs, creating Prefab variants, and using the improved Prefab Model workflows.

speaker.title: User Experience Designer
speaker.bio: Nikoline Høgh is a User Experience Designer at Unity who focuses on creating experiences that delight, empower, and improve the lives of creative professionals. Her team's mission is to challenge the status quo and be the voice that keeps Unity innovating: pushing beyond what's good enough. She holds a master's degree in Interaction Design, specializing in creative collaboration. Previously, she contributed to the designs of a number of Unity features such as 2D Sprite Shape and Tilemap.

sessions.title: Propelling AEC to New Heights by Collaborating across Platforms with AR

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value:
In this session, you'll learn how Studio 216 used Unity to create real-time sales & marketing visualizations in mixed reality (MR). You will see a variety of client examples that don't just show stunning visualizations, but illustrate how their clients collaborated in order to iterate their designs across platforms.  

Projects showcased (with more to be announced): 
- Commercial Real Estate - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRhgnqav_vrpxOalymOEU4A ; https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=89&v=bbd4ME4Vpo8 ; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=krh76PdOrVc

speaker.title: Chief Technology Officer
speaker.bio:
Bharat Ahluwalia is the CTO of Studio 216 and heads both the platform and services organizations within the company.  He is responsible for successful delivery of client projects and owns the road-map and development of Studio 216's flagship Altoura platform that enables collaborative visualization and design of physical spaces and provides a foundation for custom experiences for enterprises.

Prior to joining Studio 216, Bharat was part of the HoloLens Developer Platform team and nowadays he frequently curses himself while building apps on top of the same platform.

sessions.title: Rendering Techniques for Augmented Reality

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Have you ever wondered why your virtual and real-world objects look disconnected from each other? Are you curious about how to blend virtual and physical spaces to create a seamless experience? This talk will cover advanced techniques using lighting, depth masks, occlusion, shadows and more to create a sense of immersion.

speaker.title: Unity XR engineer
speaker.bio:
Lukasz Pasek works as an XR Software Engineer on the Unity Mixed Reality team in Bellevue, WA.
Prior to this, he worked at Microsoft creating experiences for Microsoft HoloLens. At home, he enjoys experimenting with HCI and studying machine learning.

sessions.title: Sample First Person Shooter Deep Dive – Graphics

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Sample First Person Shooter is a project designed to show product-grade implementations of Unity features, including graphics and networking, in a real-time multiplayer context. In this intermediate-level session, we focus on the High-Definition Render Pipeline (HDRP), the structure of project from an art point of view.

speaker.title: Technical Art Director
speaker.bio: Martin has been making art for games for two decades, his first steps into game art were made modding the first Quake engine games and today his experience in game production spans 4 console generations. Originally starting in environment art he expanded into technical art and tool design, he previously lead the environment art team at Io Interactive (SQEX) on the Hitman series where he also collaborated on tools and rendering development. Since 2016 he has worked as Technical Art Director on Sample Games at Unity Technologies.

sessions.title: Sample First Person Shooter Deep Dive – Networking

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Sample First Person Shooter is a project designed to show product-grade implementations of Unity features, including graphics and networking, in a real-time multiplayer context. In this intermediate-level session, we focus on the new Entity Component System (ECS) compatible networking layer, separate server/client builds and more.

speaker.title: Lead Programmer, Demo Team
speaker.bio: Peter leads a team of game developers at Unity who build example projects that help kick-start new games. He compares his team's function to that of a personal trainer keeping Unity fit and strong by exercising it daily. Before joining Unity, he was lead programmer on console and desktop games at studios like IO Interactive and Press Play. In his free time, Peter passes on the joys of programming to the next generation through the CoderDojo organization.

speaker.title: Lead Engineer, Networking
speaker.bio: Michal is the lead multiplayer and network programmer at Unity. Prior to Unity, he worked at Massive, a Ubisoft studio, where he developed and delivered multiple gamer-facing services, including uPlay. His work is credited to well-known gamer franchises such as Assassin's Creed, Silent Hunter, and Settlers.

sessions.title: Scaling AAA Multiplayer Experience with Multiplay, a Unity Company

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Acquired by Unity in November 2017, Multiplay is an Enterprise Game Server Hosting Platform made for developers who want to create real-time multiplayer experiences. Join Matthew Morris and Larry Rye from Multiplay to learn how they host and operate titles that include Titanfall 2, Gang Beasts, and PUBG.

speaker.title: Lead Solutions Engineer
speaker.bio: With over 17 years' experience as an engineer in hosting and gaming, Larry works with game engineers from  around the world to design and implement game-server hosting solutions that are focused on the genre-specific gamer experiences. Learn how he and his team have overcome some of the toughest challenges in scaling multiplayer games – from 4-player co-ops to 100-player battle royale games.

speaker.title: Head of Sales
speaker.bio: Matthew heads up the Sales, Client & Solutions teams at Multiplay, a Unity company. In this role, he leads engagements with game studios around the world to plan and design robust hosting infrastructure for their multiplayer games. Matthew has over 14 years' experience in hosting and gaming and has been instrumental in driving Multiplay's reputation as the go-to game-server hosting specialist.

sessions.title: Shifting Gears: How to Win with AR

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: See how developers are building next-generation augmented reality experiences with model targets in Vuforia Engine to drive automotive innovation.

speaker.title: Principal Product Manager, Developer Content & Evangelism
speaker.bio: Vinny DaSilva is a Developer Evangelist for the Vuforia Engine platform. Vinny is passionate about creating AR/VR experiences in Unity. Before joining Vuforia, Vinny was a consultant working with a diverse set of clients in industries such as medical devices, financial services, startups, and many more. In a previous life, Vinny spent over ten years as an engineer working in the life-sciences industry. In his current role, Vinny focuses on helping developers throughout the world create great Augmented Reality experiences.

sessions.title: Sonder Case Study: How a Passionate Global Team Created a Unique Indie Short

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Sonder is a breathtaking, 13-minute film created by SOBA, a globally distributed team of former and current employees of industry-leading studios. It began as a passion project and is now accepted to nine film festivals in 2018 alone, with more to come next year. Using a 2D toon-shaded look, even though all their assets were 3D, these creators developed some sophisticated shader designs. Come hear producer Sara K. Sampson and other members of the crew go behind the scenes in the making of this highly original and poignant short film.

speaker.title: Producer
speaker.bio: Sara K. Sampson is currently producing an unannounced Netflix original animated TV series. She is also the production supervisor for two unannounced projects, which include a Netflix original short film and John Kahrs' Google Spotlight Story. Previously, she worked as production engineer at Pixar Animations Studios on features like Inside Out, Finding Dory, and Coco.

sessions.title: Sprite Rigging Workflows in 2D Animation

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Discover the new Sprite Rigging workflows for creating 2D animation in Unity. This session will explore the tools and components that come together to create a tight iteration loop for bringing your 2D characters and worlds to life.

speaker.title: Technical Product Manager, 2D
speaker.bio: Rustum (Rus) is a Product Manager for 2D in R&D at Unity. He has been making games for more than 10 years and developing in Unity almost as long. Rus owns Craft Colony, a game production and consulting company, is a games technology generalist, and takes a holistic approach to game development. He is an MSC Malaysia Intellectual Property Creators Challenge (IPCC) winner. In 2012, Rus released Penyu the Turtle, a top‐down shooter for iOS. He also launched and managed Malaysia's first online portal for game assets. Previously, he was Technical Art Director at Big Bad Robots and Senior 3D Artist at GameBrains.

sessions.title: Stereo(scopic) 3D-180 for VR Filmmakers

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Creating a performant container app is only half the challenge of bringing great video experiences to VR – and 3D-360 isn't the answer. 3D-180 video is a new, easier way to create higher quality stereoscopic video with less effort spent on post-production. In this intermediate-level session, we'll cover best practices for creating 3D-180 video for distribution and playback in Oculus Go and other VR headsets through a live workshop. After discussing camera hardware, software tools, real-world differences between 180 and 360, spatial audio, and best practices in shooting, editing, encoding, and distribution, we will actually shoot, edit, and distribute a short video for viewing in Oculus Go.

speaker.title: Immersive Media Lead
speaker.bio: Eric is an award-winning photographer, technologist and musician who specializes in developing and applying new technologies to media and storytelling. He works as Oculus' Head of Immersive Media, and his photographic work can be found at echengphoto.com.

sessions.title: Substance PBR Materials Workflow for Real-Time Rendering

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Substance is the benchmark when it comes to creating PBR materials. In this session, Jeremie will do a deep dive into the Automotive selection available in Substance Source, showcasing how these materials are created using either a scan-based approach or fully procedural workflow. He will also show you how to texture assets using the Substance Painter LiveLink, which is available in the free Substance in Unity plugin.

speaker.title: Market Strategy Director for Entertainment
speaker.bio: Based in Los Angeles, CA, Jeremie is Allegorithmic's Market Strategy Director for Entertainment, acting as the main interface between clients in North America and Allegorithmic's development teams. He joined the company in 2006 as a technical artist, and has degrees in computer science and computer graphics.

sessions.title: Technical Deep Dive into the New Prefab System

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Take a dive deep into the new prefab features with developers Steen Lund. What's the inside versus outside of a prefab? How does it relate to Prefab mode, overrides, unpacking, and prefab variants? How has the new prefab back-end changed? This session will give you a better understanding of the Prefab system, the pros and cons of various implementation decisions, and some Aha moments working with Prefab nesting.

speaker.title: Lead Developer
speaker.bio:
Steen has been playing computer games and programming since he got a Commodore C64 as a young boy and has always known he wanted to work with games. He later got a Commodore Amiga and started writing small demos for the demo scene. The Amiga and Demo scene is still dear to him but after getting his Masters Degree games has been the main focus, only interrupted for a short time by banking software. 

Before joining Unity Steen worked on the Watchmen games at Deadline Games and Limbo at Playdead. He has now been at Unity for 7 years and has worked asset import pipeline, version control integration, multi scene editing and many other things. Currently he is leading the Scene Management team on features that will improve workflow and collaboration.

sessions.title: Testing and QA Open Mic

text.name: TALK_TEXT1
text.value: Are you involved in testing or QA on projects in Unity? Richard will provide a quick overview of the state of Unity for all things testing related, and then invite you to share your stories of success, failure, pain, and glory. Learn from your fellow developers and give feedback on how Unity could help you hold your projects to a higher quality standard.

speaker.title: Senior Software Developer
